job_description: ESD FIRMWARE ENGINEER Co-OpDivision: Enterprise and Storage DivisionLocation: Burnaby, BCAPPLY WITH RESUME AND TRANSCRIPT TO JOB # 1087915001 AND 1088015001As a Firmware Engineer Co-Op, you will join a rapidly growing team of professionals in developing exciting real-time firmware for state-of-art System-on-Chip (SoC) devices with embedded MIPS processors. Reporting to the Manager, Firmware Development, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:• Participate as part of a team in the technical analysis and integration of storage firmware architectures including SATA/SAS/RAID architectures• Development, integration, debugging, and verification of embedded firmware in C and Assembly• Work in collaboration with other PMC sites to implement solutions and resolve customer issues• Product release and maintenance
job_requirements: Qualifications• Currently enrolled in EE or Computer Science/Math, or equivalent• Demonstration of understanding of basic hardware/software interface issues and understanding of hardware system designs• Understanding of the full software lifecycle: specification, design, implementation, integration, debug, and maintenance• Good design and troubleshooting skills• Excellent analytical, communication and documentation skills• Self-starter with a passion to deliver high quality, high performance firmwareDESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS• Proficiency in C and assembly• Interest in storage protocol development such as SCSI, Fibre-Channel, SAS/SATA, RAID and/or enclosure management• Experience with embedded tools and techniques for implementation and debug• Familiar with a structured professional coding environment: participating in code reviews, following standard revision control, bug tracking, and release practices• Understanding of RTOS constructs and real time processing including processes, threads, scheduling, synchronization mechanisms, memory management.• Schedule management skills.• Knowledge of OS driver architectures in addition to Windows and Linux .• Experience with and good knowledge of MIPS architecture. • Familiar with SMP – Symmetric MultiprocessingOpen To All Majors:No
